trans-unit.source: Windows apps concept mapping for Android and iOS developers
trans-unit.target: Windows apps concept mapping for Android and iOS developers

trans-unit.source: If you're a developer with Android or iOS skills and/or code, and you want to make the move to Windows 10 and the Universal Windows Platform (UWP), then this resource has all you need to map platform features—and your knowledge—between the three platforms.
trans-unit.target: If you're a developer with Android or iOS skills and/or code, and you want to make the move to Windows 10 and the Universal Windows Platform (UWP), then this resource has all you need to map platform features—and your knowledge—between the three platforms.

trans-unit.source: Also see the porting content in [Move from iOS to UWP](ios-to-uwp-root.md).
trans-unit.target: Also see the porting content in [Move from iOS to UWP](ios-to-uwp-root.md).

trans-unit.source: Design language.
trans-unit.target: Design language.

trans-unit.source: A set of conventions that prescribe how apps on the platform should look and behave.
trans-unit.target: A set of conventions that prescribe how apps on the platform should look and behave.

trans-unit.source: **Android Material Design** guidelines provide a visual language for Android designers and developers to follow.
trans-unit.target: **Android Material Design** guidelines provide a visual language for Android designers and developers to follow.

trans-unit.source: **Human Interface Guidelines** provide advice for iOS designers and developers.
trans-unit.target: **Human Interface Guidelines** provide advice for iOS designers and developers.

trans-unit.source: [**UWP Windows Apps Design**](https://dev.windows.com/design) shows you how to create an app that looks fantastic on all Windows 10 devices.
trans-unit.target: [**UWP Windows Apps Design**](https://dev.windows.com/design) shows you how to create an app that looks fantastic on all Windows 10 devices.

trans-unit.source: You will find user-interface (UI) design fundamentals, responsive design techniques, and a full list of detailed guidelines.
trans-unit.target: You will find user-interface (UI) design fundamentals, responsive design techniques, and a full list of detailed guidelines.

trans-unit.source: User interface markup language.
trans-unit.target: User interface markup language.

trans-unit.source: A markup language that renders and describes a UI and its components.
trans-unit.target: A markup language that renders and describes a UI and its components.

trans-unit.source: Each platform provides an editor for both visual and markup editing.
trans-unit.target: Each platform provides an editor for both visual and markup editing.

trans-unit.source: **XML layouts**, edited using **Android Studio** or **Eclipse**.
trans-unit.target: **XML layouts**, edited using **Android Studio** or **Eclipse**.

trans-unit.source: **XIB** and **Storyboards** edited using **Interface Builder** inside Xcode.
trans-unit.target: **XIB** and **Storyboards** edited using **Interface Builder** inside Xcode.

trans-unit.source: **[XAML](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/mt185595.aspx)**, edited using **[Microsoft Visual Studio](https://www.visualstudio.com/)** and **[Blend for Visual Studio](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/jj171012.aspx)**.
trans-unit.target: **[XAML](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/mt185595.aspx)**, edited using **[Microsoft Visual Studio](https://www.visualstudio.com/)** and **[Blend for Visual Studio](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/jj171012.aspx)**.

trans-unit.source: Built-in user interface controls.
trans-unit.target: Built-in user interface controls.

trans-unit.source: Reusable UI elements provided by the platform such as buttons, list controls, and text controls.
trans-unit.target: Reusable UI elements provided by the platform such as buttons, list controls, and text controls.

trans-unit.source: Prebuilt **view** and **view group** classes referred to as widgets, layouts, text fields, containers, date/time controls and expert controls.
trans-unit.target: Prebuilt **view** and **view group** classes referred to as widgets, layouts, text fields, containers, date/time controls and expert controls.

trans-unit.source: **Views** and **controls** found in the Xcode object library and listed in the UIKit user interface catalog.
trans-unit.target: **Views** and **controls** found in the Xcode object library and listed in the UIKit user interface catalog.

trans-unit.source: Views include image views, picker views and scroll views.
trans-unit.target: Views include image views, picker views and scroll views.

trans-unit.source: Controls include buttons, date pickers and text fields.
trans-unit.target: Controls include buttons, date pickers and text fields.

trans-unit.source: The XAML platform provides you with a generous set of **built-in controls** such as buttons, list controls, panels, text controls, command bars, pickers, media, and inking.
trans-unit.target: The XAML platform provides you with a generous set of **built-in controls** such as buttons, list controls, panels, text controls, command bars, pickers, media, and inking.

trans-unit.source: Add controls and handle events
trans-unit.target: Add controls and handle events

trans-unit.source: Control event-handling.
trans-unit.target: Control event-handling.

trans-unit.source: Defining the logic that runs when events are triggered within UI controls.
trans-unit.target: Defining the logic that runs when events are triggered within UI controls.

trans-unit.source: **Event handlers** and **event listeners** are added in XML or programmatically.
trans-unit.target: **Event handlers** and **event listeners** are added in XML or programmatically.

trans-unit.source: Controls send **action** messages to **targets**.
trans-unit.target: Controls send **action** messages to **targets**.

trans-unit.source: You can define methods to handle the events of a XAML control in a **code-behind file** attached to the XAML page.
trans-unit.target: You can define methods to handle the events of a XAML control in a **code-behind file** attached to the XAML page.

trans-unit.source: **Event handlers** are always written in code.
trans-unit.target: **Event handlers** are always written in code.

trans-unit.source: But you can hook those handlers to events either in XAML markup or in code.
trans-unit.target: But you can hook those handlers to events either in XAML markup or in code.

trans-unit.source: Add controls and handle events
trans-unit.target: Add controls and handle events

trans-unit.source: Events and routed events overview
trans-unit.target: Events and routed events overview

trans-unit.source: Data binding.
trans-unit.target: Data binding.

trans-unit.source: A software design pattern that allows your app UI to render data and optionally stay in sync with that data.
trans-unit.target: A software design pattern that allows your app UI to render data and optionally stay in sync with that data.

trans-unit.source: There is a **Data Binding Library** provided, although it is still in beta.
trans-unit.target: There is a **Data Binding Library** provided, although it is still in beta.

trans-unit.source: No built-in bindings system exists on iOS.
trans-unit.target: No built-in bindings system exists on iOS.

trans-unit.source: **Key-value observing** can be built upon to perform data binding, either with the use of a third-party library, or writing additional code.
trans-unit.target: **Key-value observing** can be built upon to perform data binding, either with the use of a third-party library, or writing additional code.

trans-unit.source: Controls use a delegate/callback approach for obtaining data.
trans-unit.target: Controls use a delegate/callback approach for obtaining data.

trans-unit.source: The UWP platform handles **data binding** for you.
trans-unit.target: The UWP platform handles **data binding** for you.

trans-unit.source: You use the **[{x:Bind}](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt204783.aspx)** markup extension to take advantage of high performance binding or **[{Binding}](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt204782.aspx)** to take advantage of more features.
trans-unit.target: You use the **[{x:Bind}](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt204783.aspx)** markup extension to take advantage of high performance binding or **[{Binding}](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt204782.aspx)** to take advantage of more features.

trans-unit.source: It’s then just a case of configuring your binding to choose whether the platform uses **one-way binding** to display values from a data source in your UI, or whether it also observes those values and updates your UI when they change with **two-way binding**.
trans-unit.target: It’s then just a case of configuring your binding to choose whether the platform uses **one-way binding** to display values from a data source in your UI, or whether it also observes those values and updates your UI when they change with **two-way binding**.

trans-unit.source: Data Binding
trans-unit.target: Data Binding

trans-unit.source: UI Automation.
trans-unit.target: UI Automation.

trans-unit.source: Programmatic access to UI elements, making apps accessible to assistive technology products and enabling automated test scripts to interact with your UI.
trans-unit.target: Programmatic access to UI elements, making apps accessible to assistive technology products and enabling automated test scripts to interact with your UI.

trans-unit.source: **Text labels**, **contentDescription** and **hint** values help ensure UI elements can be found by automation.
trans-unit.target: **Text labels**, **contentDescription** and **hint** values help ensure UI elements can be found by automation.

trans-unit.source: Android Studio allows you to write UI tests using the **UI Automator** and **Espresso** testing frameworks.
trans-unit.target: Android Studio allows you to write UI tests using the **UI Automator** and **Espresso** testing frameworks.

trans-unit.source: The **Automation instrument** allows you to write automated UI test scripts which identify elements using the **accessibility** settings or the element's position in the **element hierarchy**.
trans-unit.target: The **Automation instrument** allows you to write automated UI test scripts which identify elements using the **accessibility** settings or the element's position in the **element hierarchy**.

trans-unit.source: You get programmatic access to built-in UI elements in UWP out-of-box with **[UI Automation](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/ee684076.aspx)**.
trans-unit.target: You get programmatic access to built-in UI elements in UWP out-of-box with **[UI Automation](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/ee684076.aspx)**.

trans-unit.source: **[Custom Automation Peers](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt297667.aspx)** allow you to provide automation support for your own custom UI classes.
trans-unit.target: **[Custom Automation Peers](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt297667.aspx)** allow you to provide automation support for your own custom UI classes.

trans-unit.source: The **[Coded UI Test Project](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dd286726.aspx#VerifyingCodeUsingCUITCreate)** in Visual Studio allows you to automatically test your whole application through the UI, or to test the UI in isolation.
trans-unit.target: The **[Coded UI Test Project](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dd286726.aspx#VerifyingCodeUsingCUITCreate)** in Visual Studio allows you to automatically test your whole application through the UI, or to test the UI in isolation.

trans-unit.source: Changing the appearance of a control.
trans-unit.target: Changing the appearance of a control.

trans-unit.source: Editing size, color and other attributes.
trans-unit.target: Editing size, color and other attributes.

trans-unit.source: Controls have **properties** which can be edited using the designer tool, in XML markup or programmatically.
trans-unit.target: Controls have **properties** which can be edited using the designer tool, in XML markup or programmatically.

trans-unit.source: Controls have **attributes** which you can edit using the **Attributes Inspector** in Interface Builder or programmatically.
trans-unit.target: Controls have **attributes** which you can edit using the **Attributes Inspector** in Interface Builder or programmatically.

trans-unit.source: You can edit the **properties** of controls in the XAML markup or programmatically, using Visual Studio and Blend for Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: You can edit the **properties** of controls in the XAML markup or programmatically, using Visual Studio and Blend for Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Add controls and handle events
trans-unit.target: Add controls and handle events

trans-unit.source: Reusable visual styles.
trans-unit.target: Reusable visual styles.

trans-unit.source: Apply visual changes to a number of controls, in a reusable format.
trans-unit.target: Apply visual changes to a number of controls, in a reusable format.

trans-unit.source: **XML styles** are sets of properties that are applied to one or more controls.
trans-unit.target: **XML styles** are sets of properties that are applied to one or more controls.

trans-unit.source: iOS does not support reusable visual styles out-of-box, but the UIAppearance protocol allows multiple controls to share common attributes.
trans-unit.target: iOS does not support reusable visual styles out-of-box, but the UIAppearance protocol allows multiple controls to share common attributes.

trans-unit.source: You can create reusable **[styles](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.style.aspx)**, which can be applied to multiple controls and stored in a **[ResourceDictionary](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.resourcedictionary.aspx)** for easy reuse.
trans-unit.target: You can create reusable **[styles](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.style.aspx)**, which can be applied to multiple controls and stored in a **[ResourceDictionary](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.resourcedictionary.aspx)** for easy reuse.

trans-unit.source: Quickstart: Styling Controls
trans-unit.target: Quickstart: Styling Controls

trans-unit.source: Editing the visual structure of controls.
trans-unit.target: Editing the visual structure of controls.

trans-unit.source: Customize the visual structure of a control beyond just modifying properties or attributes, e.g. moving the checkbox text underneath the checkbox.
trans-unit.target: Customize the visual structure of a control beyond just modifying properties or attributes, e.g. moving the checkbox text underneath the checkbox.

trans-unit.source: No simple method of editing the visual structure of controls exists in Android.
trans-unit.target: No simple method of editing the visual structure of controls exists in Android.

trans-unit.source: No simple method of editing the visual structure of controls exists in iOS.
trans-unit.target: No simple method of editing the visual structure of controls exists in iOS.

trans-unit.source: To customize the visual structure of a control, you can copy and edit its **[control template](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.controltemplate.aspx)** in XAML markup.
trans-unit.target: To customize the visual structure of a control, you can copy and edit its **[control template](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.controltemplate.aspx)** in XAML markup.

trans-unit.source: Quickstart: Control Templates
trans-unit.target: Quickstart: Control Templates

trans-unit.source: Built-in touch gestures.
trans-unit.target: Built-in touch gestures.

trans-unit.source: Provide customized touch support by handling high level abstracted gesture events such as tap and double tap in views and controls.
trans-unit.target: Provide customized touch support by handling high level abstracted gesture events such as tap and double tap in views and controls.

trans-unit.source: **Gesture detectors** detect common touch gestures including scrolling, long-press, tap, double-tap and fling.
trans-unit.target: **Gesture detectors** detect common touch gestures including scrolling, long-press, tap, double-tap and fling.

trans-unit.source: UIKit framework provides built-in **gesture recognizers** which detect touch gestures including tap, pinch, pan, swipe, rotate and long-press.
trans-unit.target: UIKit framework provides built-in **gesture recognizers** which detect touch gestures including tap, pinch, pan, swipe, rotate and long-press.

trans-unit.source: **UI elements** allow you to handle **static gesture events** including tap, double-tap, right-tap and holding, as well as **manipulation gesture events** including slide, swipe, turn, pinch and stretch.
trans-unit.target: **UI elements** allow you to handle **static gesture events** including tap, double-tap, right-tap and holding, as well as **manipulation gesture events** including slide, swipe, turn, pinch and stretch.

trans-unit.source: Gesture events are **routed events** and can be handled by parent objects containing the child UIElement.
trans-unit.target: Gesture events are **routed events** and can be handled by parent objects containing the child UIElement.

trans-unit.source: Touch interactions
trans-unit.target: Touch interactions

trans-unit.target: Custom user interactions - gestures, manipulations, and interactions

trans-unit.source: Layouts.
trans-unit.target: Layouts.

trans-unit.source: The layout defines the structure of the user interface.
trans-unit.target: The layout defines the structure of the user interface.

trans-unit.source: Layout is composed of **view groups** such as the **LinearLayout** and the **RelativeLayout** which can nest other view groups or views.
trans-unit.target: Layout is composed of **view groups** such as the **LinearLayout** and the **RelativeLayout** which can nest other view groups or views.

trans-unit.source: Layout is composed of a **UIViewController** containing **UIView**'s which can be nested.
trans-unit.target: Layout is composed of a **UIViewController** containing **UIView**'s which can be nested.

trans-unit.source: XAML which provides a flexible layout system composed of **layout panel classes** such as **[Canvas](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.canvas.aspx)**, **[Grid](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.grid.aspx)**, **[RelativePanel](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.relativepanel.aspx)** and **[StackPanel](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.stackpanel.aspx)** for static and responsive layouts.
trans-unit.target: XAML which provides a flexible layout system composed of **layout panel classes** such as **[Canvas](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.canvas.aspx)**, **[Grid](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.grid.aspx)**, **[RelativePanel](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.relativepanel.aspx)** and **[StackPanel](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.stackpanel.aspx)** for static and responsive layouts.

trans-unit.source: **[Properties](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms171352.aspx)** are used to control the size and position of the elements.
trans-unit.target: **[Properties](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms171352.aspx)** are used to control the size and position of the elements.

trans-unit.source: Define layouts with XAML
trans-unit.target: Define layouts with XAML

trans-unit.source: Peer-to-peer navigation.
trans-unit.target: Peer-to-peer navigation.

trans-unit.source: Presenting the user with methods of navigating between pages of equal hierarchical importance.
trans-unit.target: Presenting the user with methods of navigating between pages of equal hierarchical importance.

trans-unit.source: **Tabs**, **swipe views** and **navigation drawers** provide **lateral navigation**.
trans-unit.target: **Tabs**, **swipe views** and **navigation drawers** provide **lateral navigation**.

trans-unit.source: **Tab bar controllers**, **split view controllers** and **page view controllers** allow navigation between views of equal hierarchy.
trans-unit.target: **Tab bar controllers**, **split view controllers** and **page view controllers** allow navigation between views of equal hierarchy.

trans-unit.source: You can display a persistent list of links/tabs above the content using **[tabs/pivots](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn997788.aspx)**.
trans-unit.target: You can display a persistent list of links/tabs above the content using **[tabs/pivots](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn997788.aspx)**.

trans-unit.source: The **[navigation pane/split view](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn997787.aspx)** lets you display a list of links alongside the content.
trans-unit.target: The **[navigation pane/split view](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn997787.aspx)** lets you display a list of links alongside the content.

trans-unit.source: Navigation
trans-unit.target: Navigation

trans-unit.source: Peer to peer navigation between two pages
trans-unit.target: Peer to peer navigation between two pages

trans-unit.source: Hierarchical navigation.
trans-unit.target: Hierarchical navigation.

trans-unit.source: Navigating between parent and child pages of a hierarchy.
trans-unit.target: Navigating between parent and child pages of a hierarchy.

trans-unit.source: **Lists**, and **grid lists**, **buttons** and other controls provide **descendent navigation** when used with **intents** to load other **activities**.
trans-unit.target: **Lists**, and **grid lists**, **buttons** and other controls provide **descendent navigation** when used with **intents** to load other **activities**.

trans-unit.source: **Navigation controllers** allow users to navigate between levels of a hierarchy.
trans-unit.target: **Navigation controllers** allow users to navigate between levels of a hierarchy.

trans-unit.source: **[Hubs](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn449149.aspx)** let you show the user a preview of content which can be selected to navigate to child pages.
trans-unit.target: **[Hubs](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn449149.aspx)** let you show the user a preview of content which can be selected to navigate to child pages.

trans-unit.source: **[Master/details](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn997765.aspx)** let users pick from a list of item summaries which display next to the corresponding detail section.
trans-unit.target: **[Master/details](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn997765.aspx)** let users pick from a list of item summaries which display next to the corresponding detail section.

trans-unit.source: Navigation
trans-unit.target: Navigation

trans-unit.source: Back button navigation.
trans-unit.target: Back button navigation.

trans-unit.source: Navigating back through an application.
trans-unit.target: Navigating back through an application.

trans-unit.source: The **back** and **up** buttons inside the action bar provide **ancestral** and **temporal** navigation using the **back stack**.
trans-unit.target: The **back** and **up** buttons inside the action bar provide **ancestral** and **temporal** navigation using the **back stack**.

trans-unit.source: The **navigation controller** can have a back button added to it.
trans-unit.target: The **navigation controller** can have a back button added to it.

trans-unit.source: You can handle software or hardware back button presses easily using the **[back stack property](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.frame.backstack.aspx)** which allows your users to traverse the **navigation history**.
trans-unit.target: You can handle software or hardware back button presses easily using the **[back stack property](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.frame.backstack.aspx)** which allows your users to traverse the **navigation history**.

trans-unit.source: Splash screen.
trans-unit.target: Splash screen.

trans-unit.source: Showing an image on app launch, used primarily for branding.
trans-unit.target: Showing an image on app launch, used primarily for branding.

trans-unit.source: Splash screens are not provided by default, and are implemented by editing the first activities **theme background**.
trans-unit.target: Splash screens are not provided by default, and are implemented by editing the first activities **theme background**.

trans-unit.source: Apps must either have a **static launch image** or **XIB/storyboard launch file**.
trans-unit.target: Apps must either have a **static launch image** or **XIB/storyboard launch file**.

trans-unit.source: You create a splash screen using an **image** and colored background.
trans-unit.target: You create a splash screen using an **image** and colored background.

trans-unit.source: [Splash screen time can be extended](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187309.aspx).
trans-unit.target: [Splash screen time can be extended](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187309.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Voice.
trans-unit.target: Voice.

trans-unit.source: Speech recognition for speech input, and additional voice capabilities.
trans-unit.target: Speech recognition for speech input, and additional voice capabilities.

trans-unit.source: Speech input can be provided by any app which implements a **RecognizerIntent**, such as **Google Voice Search**.
trans-unit.target: Speech input can be provided by any app which implements a **RecognizerIntent**, such as **Google Voice Search**.

trans-unit.source: The **SpeechRecognizer** class allows apps to use Google's speech recognition API.
trans-unit.target: The **SpeechRecognizer** class allows apps to use Google's speech recognition API.

trans-unit.source: No built-in speech recognition or speech input APIs exist.
trans-unit.target: No built-in speech recognition or speech input APIs exist.

trans-unit.source: You can use the **[speech recognition](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt185615.aspx)** API to interact with your app in the foreground.
trans-unit.target: You can use the **[speech recognition](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt185615.aspx)** API to interact with your app in the foreground.

trans-unit.source: You can use speech-based **[Cortana interactions](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt185598.aspx)** to launch apps in the foreground or background, and to ​interact with background apps.
trans-unit.target: You can use speech-based **[Cortana interactions](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt185598.aspx)** to launch apps in the foreground or background, and to ​interact with background apps.

trans-unit.source: Custom user inputs.
trans-unit.target: Custom user inputs.

trans-unit.source: Handling keyboard, mouse, stylus and other inputs.
trans-unit.target: Handling keyboard, mouse, stylus and other inputs.

trans-unit.source: Support for interactions includes **touch**, **touchpad**, **stylus**, **mouse** and **keyboard**.
trans-unit.target: Support for interactions includes **touch**, **touchpad**, **stylus**, **mouse** and **keyboard**.

trans-unit.source: Movements and inputs are reported in the same way as touch, but it is possible to detect more information about the **input device**.
trans-unit.target: Movements and inputs are reported in the same way as touch, but it is possible to detect more information about the **input device**.

trans-unit.source: Support for **touch**, the **Apple Pencil** and hardware **keyboards** are provided.
trans-unit.target: Support for **touch**, the **Apple Pencil** and hardware **keyboards** are provided.

trans-unit.source: You will find support for a wide range of interactions including **[touch](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt185617.aspx)**, **[touchpad](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187313.aspx)**, **[pen/stylus](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187311.aspx)** with digital ink, **[mouse](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187308.aspx)** and **[keyboard](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt185607.aspx)**.
trans-unit.target: You will find support for a wide range of interactions including **[touch](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt185617.aspx)**, **[touchpad](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187313.aspx)**, **[pen/stylus](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187311.aspx)** with digital ink, **[mouse](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187308.aspx)** and **[keyboard](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt185607.aspx)**.

trans-unit.source: Your apps can handle the data without needing to know which input device was used, and raw input device data can be accessed if needed.
trans-unit.target: Your apps can handle the data without needing to know which input device was used, and raw input device data can be accessed if needed.

trans-unit.target: Handle pointer input

trans-unit.source: Local app data.
trans-unit.target: Local app data.

trans-unit.source: Storing settings and files related to your app locally.
trans-unit.target: Storing settings and files related to your app locally.

trans-unit.source: Local files can be saved using **openFileOutput** and **openFileInput**.
trans-unit.target: Local files can be saved using **openFileOutput** and **openFileInput**.

trans-unit.source: Settings in a **shared preferences file** can be accessed using **getSharedPreferences**.
trans-unit.target: Settings in a **shared preferences file** can be accessed using **getSharedPreferences**.

trans-unit.source: Local files can be stored in the **application support** directory, accessed via the **NSFileManager** class.
trans-unit.target: Local files can be stored in the **application support** directory, accessed via the **NSFileManager** class.

trans-unit.source: Settings in **preferences** files can be accessed by the **NSUserDefaults** class.
trans-unit.target: Settings in **preferences** files can be accessed by the **NSUserDefaults** class.

trans-unit.source: The **[Windows.Storage](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/br230562.aspx)** classes handle local data storage for you in a unified way.
trans-unit.target: The **[Windows.Storage](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/br230562.aspx)** classes handle local data storage for you in a unified way.

trans-unit.source: You store settings as an **[ApplicationDataContainer](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.storage.applicationdatacontainer.aspx)** object, accessed via the **[ApplicationData.LocalSettings](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.storage.applicationdata.localsettings.aspx)** property.
trans-unit.target: You store settings as an **[ApplicationDataContainer](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.storage.applicationdatacontainer.aspx)** object, accessed via the **[ApplicationData.LocalSettings](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.storage.applicationdata.localsettings.aspx)** property.

trans-unit.source: You store files in a **[StorageFolder](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.storage.storagefolder.aspx)** object accessed via the **[ApplicationData.LocalFolder](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.storage.applicationdata.localfolder.aspx)** property.
trans-unit.target: You store files in a **[StorageFolder](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.storage.storagefolder.aspx)** object accessed via the **[ApplicationData.LocalFolder](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.storage.applicationdata.localfolder.aspx)** property.

trans-unit.source: Store and retrieve settings and other app data
trans-unit.target: Store and retrieve settings and other app data

trans-unit.source: Local database storage.
trans-unit.target: Local database storage.

trans-unit.source: Storing app data in a relational database, with object-relational mappers (ORM) if applicable.
trans-unit.target: Storing app data in a relational database, with object-relational mappers (ORM) if applicable.

trans-unit.source: The **SQLite** database is provided.
trans-unit.target: The **SQLite** database is provided.

trans-unit.source: No ORM is built-in.
trans-unit.target: No ORM is built-in.

trans-unit.source: SQL queries are run using the **SQLiteDatabase** class.
trans-unit.target: SQL queries are run using the **SQLiteDatabase** class.

trans-unit.source: The **SQLite** database is provided.
trans-unit.target: The **SQLite** database is provided.

trans-unit.source: **CoreData** is the built-in object graph framework which can be used with SQLite and provide functionality comparable with an ORM.
trans-unit.target: **CoreData** is the built-in object graph framework which can be used with SQLite and provide functionality comparable with an ORM.

trans-unit.source: You can store data using **SQLite**.
trans-unit.target: You can store data using **SQLite**.

trans-unit.source: **[Entity Framework](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/mt592863.aspx)** is a built-in ORM which eliminates the need to write lots of data access code and enables you to easily query the database without writing SQL.
trans-unit.target: **[Entity Framework](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/mt592863.aspx)** is a built-in ORM which eliminates the need to write lots of data access code and enables you to easily query the database without writing SQL.

trans-unit.source: You can run SQL queries directly with the [SQLite library](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/mt592864.aspx).
trans-unit.target: You can run SQL queries directly with the [SQLite library](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/mt592864.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Data Access
trans-unit.target: Data Access

trans-unit.source: HTTP libraries for REST access.
trans-unit.target: HTTP libraries for REST access.

trans-unit.source: Built-in libraries that let you communicate with web services and web servers using HTTP(S).
trans-unit.target: Built-in libraries that let you communicate with web services and web servers using HTTP(S).

trans-unit.source: HTTP libraries **HttpURLConnection** and **Volley**.
trans-unit.target: HTTP libraries **HttpURLConnection** and **Volley**.

trans-unit.source: **NSURLSession**, **NSURLConnection** and **NSURLDownload**.
trans-unit.target: **NSURLSession**, **NSURLConnection** and **NSURLDownload**.

trans-unit.source: You can use the built-in **[HttpClient](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.web.http.httpclient)** API to access common HTTP functionality including GET, DELETE, PUT, POST, common authentication patterns, SSL, cookies and progress info.
trans-unit.target: You can use the built-in **[HttpClient](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.web.http.httpclient)** API to access common HTTP functionality including GET, DELETE, PUT, POST, common authentication patterns, SSL, cookies and progress info.

trans-unit.source: Cloud backup services.
trans-unit.target: Cloud backup services.

trans-unit.source: Platform-provided backup services for app data.
trans-unit.target: Platform-provided backup services for app data.

trans-unit.source: Android's **backup manager** handles the backing up of application data in Google's **Android Backup Service**.
trans-unit.target: Android's **backup manager** handles the backing up of application data in Google's **Android Backup Service**.

trans-unit.source: **iCloud Backup** can be configured by a user to handle their backups, including app data.
trans-unit.target: **iCloud Backup** can be configured by a user to handle their backups, including app data.

trans-unit.source: Apps which use iCloud compatible **Core Data**, the **iCloud key-value store** and **iCloud document storage**.
trans-unit.target: Apps which use iCloud compatible **Core Data**, the **iCloud key-value store** and **iCloud document storage**.

trans-unit.source: Any app data that you store using the roaming **[ApplicationData APIs](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.storage.applicationdata.aspx)** (including **[RoamingFolder](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.storage.applicationdata.roamingfolder.aspx)** and [**RoamingSettings**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.storage.applicationdata.roamingsettings.aspx)) will be automatically synced to the cloud and to the user’s other devices, too.
trans-unit.target: Any app data that you store using the roaming **[ApplicationData APIs](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.storage.applicationdata.aspx)** (including **[RoamingFolder](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.storage.applicationdata.roamingfolder.aspx)** and [**RoamingSettings**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.storage.applicationdata.roamingsettings.aspx)) will be automatically synced to the cloud and to the user’s other devices, too.

trans-unit.source: The syncing is done by way of the user’s Microsoft account.
trans-unit.target: The syncing is done by way of the user’s Microsoft account.

trans-unit.source: Guidelines for roaming app data
trans-unit.target: Guidelines for roaming app data

trans-unit.source: HTTP file downloads.
trans-unit.target: HTTP file downloads.

trans-unit.source: Downloading large and small files over HTTP.
trans-unit.target: Downloading large and small files over HTTP.

trans-unit.source: **URLConnection** and **HTTPURLConnection** are used to download over HTTP and FTP, it is also possible to make use of the system **download manager** to download in the background.
trans-unit.target: **URLConnection** and **HTTPURLConnection** are used to download over HTTP and FTP, it is also possible to make use of the system **download manager** to download in the background.

trans-unit.source: **NSURLSession** and **NSURLConnection** can be used to download files over HTTP and FTP.
trans-unit.target: **NSURLSession** and **NSURLConnection** can be used to download files over HTTP and FTP.

trans-unit.source: The **[background transfer API](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.networking.backgroundtransfer.aspx)** lets you reliably transfer files over HTTP(S) and FTP, taking into account app suspension, connectivity loss and adjusting based on connectivity and battery life.
trans-unit.target: The **[background transfer API](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.networking.backgroundtransfer.aspx)** lets you reliably transfer files over HTTP(S) and FTP, taking into account app suspension, connectivity loss and adjusting based on connectivity and battery life.

trans-unit.source: You can also use **[HttpClient](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.web.http.httpclient.aspx)** which is ideal for smaller files.
trans-unit.target: You can also use **[HttpClient](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.web.http.httpclient.aspx)** which is ideal for smaller files.

trans-unit.source: Sockets.
trans-unit.target: Sockets.

trans-unit.source: Creating low level UDP datagram and TCP sockets to communicate with other devices using your own protocol.
trans-unit.target: Creating low level UDP datagram and TCP sockets to communicate with other devices using your own protocol.

trans-unit.source: **Socket** class provides TCP sockets, **DatagramSocket** class provides a UDP socket.
trans-unit.target: **Socket** class provides TCP sockets, **DatagramSocket** class provides a UDP socket.

trans-unit.source: **NSStream** and **CFStream** provide TCP sockets, **CFSocket** provides UDP sockets.
trans-unit.target: **NSStream** and **CFStream** provide TCP sockets, **CFSocket** provides UDP sockets.

trans-unit.source: You can use the **[DatagramSocket](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241319)** class to communicate using a UDP datagram socket and the **[StreamSocket](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882)** class to communicate over TCP or Bluetooth RFCOMM.
trans-unit.target: You can use the **[DatagramSocket](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241319)** class to communicate using a UDP datagram socket and the **[StreamSocket](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882)** class to communicate over TCP or Bluetooth RFCOMM.

trans-unit.source: WebSockets.
trans-unit.target: WebSockets.

trans-unit.source: Provide two-way communication between a client and server, enabling real-time data transfer.
trans-unit.target: Provide two-way communication between a client and server, enabling real-time data transfer.

trans-unit.source: No built-in WebSockets libraries exist on Android.
trans-unit.target: No built-in WebSockets libraries exist on Android.

trans-unit.source: No built-in WebSockets libraries exist on iOS.
trans-unit.target: No built-in WebSockets libraries exist on iOS.

trans-unit.source: Secure connections to servers supporting WebSockets can be made with the **[MessageWebSocket](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.networking.sockets.messagewebsocket.aspx)** class for smaller messages with receipt notifications and **[StreamWebSocket](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.networking.sockets.streamwebsocket.aspx)** for larger binary file transfers which can be read in sections.
trans-unit.target: Secure connections to servers supporting WebSockets can be made with the **[MessageWebSocket](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.networking.sockets.messagewebsocket.aspx)** class for smaller messages with receipt notifications and **[StreamWebSocket](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.networking.sockets.streamwebsocket.aspx)** for larger binary file transfers which can be read in sections.

trans-unit.source: OAuth libraries.
trans-unit.target: OAuth libraries.

trans-unit.source: OAuth libraries allowing access to third party OAuth providers, and any account management built into the platform.
trans-unit.target: OAuth libraries allowing access to third party OAuth providers, and any account management built into the platform.

trans-unit.source: No generic OAuth library is provided.
trans-unit.target: No generic OAuth library is provided.

trans-unit.source: The **GoogleAuthUtil** class is provided for OAuth authentication with Google Play Services .
trans-unit.target: The **GoogleAuthUtil** class is provided for OAuth authentication with Google Play Services .

trans-unit.source: No generic OAuth library is provided.
trans-unit.target: No generic OAuth library is provided.

trans-unit.source: The **accounts framework** provides access to user accounts already stored on the device such as Facebook and Twitter.
trans-unit.target: The **accounts framework** provides access to user accounts already stored on the device such as Facebook and Twitter.

trans-unit.source: The generic OAuth library **[Web authentication broker](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt270196.aspx)** lets you connect to third-party identity provider services.
trans-unit.target: The generic OAuth library **[Web authentication broker](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt270196.aspx)** lets you connect to third-party identity provider services.

trans-unit.source: The **[Credential locker](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt270189.aspx)** allows your users to save their login and use it on multiple devices.
trans-unit.target: The **[Credential locker](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt270189.aspx)** allows your users to save their login and use it on multiple devices.

trans-unit.source: The **[Microsoft.Live](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn896755.aspx)** namespace lets you easily access Live SDK OAuth for access to Microsoft services.
trans-unit.target: The **[Microsoft.Live](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn896755.aspx)** namespace lets you easily access Live SDK OAuth for access to Microsoft services.

trans-unit.target: Xcode

trans-unit.source: **[Visual Studio](https://www.visualstudio.com/features/universal-windows-platform-vs.aspx)** and **[Blend for Visual Studio](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/jj171012.aspx)** has all the tools you need to code, design, connect, debug, analyze, optimize and test UWP apps.
trans-unit.target: **[Visual Studio](https://www.visualstudio.com/features/universal-windows-platform-vs.aspx)** and **[Blend for Visual Studio](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/jj171012.aspx)** has all the tools you need to code, design, connect, debug, analyze, optimize and test UWP apps.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio also provides you with **[emulators](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt188754.aspx)** for Windows 10 devices, so you can test your app across a range of emulated devices.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio also provides you with **[emulators](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt188754.aspx)** for Windows 10 devices, so you can test your app across a range of emulated devices.

trans-unit.target: Code organization.

trans-unit.source: The basic folder structure of an app, often created from an initial template.
trans-unit.target: The basic folder structure of an app, often created from an initial template.

trans-unit.source: **AndroidManifest** file, **java** folder containing source files, **res** folder with resources including layouts and values, **Gradle** build scripts in Android Studio and **Ant** build scripts in Eclipse.
trans-unit.target: **AndroidManifest** file, **java** folder containing source files, **res** folder with resources including layouts and values, **Gradle** build scripts in Android Studio and **Ant** build scripts in Eclipse.

trans-unit.source: Source files and **Supporting Files**, **Info.plist** file, **Main.storyboard** and **LaunchScreen.storyboard**.
trans-unit.target: Source files and **Supporting Files**, **Info.plist** file, **Main.storyboard** and **LaunchScreen.storyboard**.

trans-unit.source: Images are stored in **Asset libraries**.
trans-unit.target: Images are stored in **Asset libraries**.

trans-unit.source: Your UWP app contains XAML and code files for your app named Example.xaml and Example.xaml.cs, various images in the **Assets folder**, a start page such as **MainPage.xaml** and **MainPage.xaml.cs** and a manifest.
trans-unit.target: Your UWP app contains XAML and code files for your app named Example.xaml and Example.xaml.cs, various images in the **Assets folder**, a start page such as **MainPage.xaml** and **MainPage.xaml.cs** and a manifest.

trans-unit.source: App lifecycle.
trans-unit.target: App lifecycle.

trans-unit.source: Handling events on app launch, suspension, resume and close, providing an opportunity to save/restore application state and run other tasks.
trans-unit.target: Handling events on app launch, suspension, resume and close, providing an opportunity to save/restore application state and run other tasks.

trans-unit.source: Each activity has its own **activity lifecycle** with states such as **resumed**.
trans-unit.target: Each activity has its own **activity lifecycle** with states such as **resumed**.

trans-unit.source: **Lifecycle callbacks** such as **onResume** are implemented in in your **activity classes**.
trans-unit.target: **Lifecycle callbacks** such as **onResume** are implemented in in your **activity classes**.

trans-unit.source: The **application lifecycle** has states such as **suspended**.
trans-unit.target: The **application lifecycle** has states such as **suspended**.

trans-unit.source: Methods such as **applicationDidEnterBackground:** are implemented in the **application delegate object** to run code on state changes.
trans-unit.target: Methods such as **applicationDidEnterBackground:** are implemented in the **application delegate object** to run code on state changes.

trans-unit.source: Your application has the **app execution states** NotRunning, Activated, Running, Suspending, Suspended and Resuming.
trans-unit.target: Your application has the **app execution states** NotRunning, Activated, Running, Suspending, Suspended and Resuming.

trans-unit.source: You can implement the **[Application class](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.application.aspx)** methods OnLaunched, OnActivated, Suspending or Resuming in your app to run code when the state changes.
trans-unit.target: You can implement the **[Application class](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.application.aspx)** methods OnLaunched, OnActivated, Suspending or Resuming in your app to run code when the state changes.

trans-unit.source: App lifecycle
trans-unit.target: App lifecycle

trans-unit.source: Background tasks.
trans-unit.target: Background tasks.

trans-unit.source: Tasks that perform background operations and continue to run when the app is no longer in the foreground.
trans-unit.target: Tasks that perform background operations and continue to run when the app is no longer in the foreground.

trans-unit.source: Apps can launch **services** which perform background operations when the app is no longer in the foreground.
trans-unit.target: Apps can launch **services** which perform background operations when the app is no longer in the foreground.

trans-unit.source: Services have their own **lifecycle** and are registered in the manifest.
trans-unit.target: Services have their own **lifecycle** and are registered in the manifest.

trans-unit.source: **Background execution** is only permitted for specific task types.
trans-unit.target: **Background execution** is only permitted for specific task types.

trans-unit.source: Apps declare **supported background tasks** in the Info.plist file using the **UIBackgroundModes**.
trans-unit.target: Apps declare **supported background tasks** in the Info.plist file using the **UIBackgroundModes**.

trans-unit.source: The system controls when background tasks are run and for how long.
trans-unit.target: The system controls when background tasks are run and for how long.

trans-unit.source: You can create a background task by implementing the **[IBackgroundTask](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.applicationmodel.background.ibackgroundtask.aspx)** interface and registering the task in the application manifest.
trans-unit.target: You can create a background task by implementing the **[IBackgroundTask](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.applicationmodel.background.ibackgroundtask.aspx)** interface and registering the task in the application manifest.

trans-unit.source: You can set a task to be triggered with a [**timer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt186458.aspx), [**system trigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.applicationmodel.background.systemtriggertype.aspx), and [**maintenance trigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt185632.aspx).
trans-unit.target: You can set a task to be triggered with a [**timer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt186458.aspx), [**system trigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.applicationmodel.background.systemtriggertype.aspx), and [**maintenance trigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt185632.aspx).

trans-unit.target: Support your app with background tasks

trans-unit.source: Performance best practices.
trans-unit.target: Performance best practices.

trans-unit.source: Guidelines for building apps that are fast, responsive, considerate of battery life with a fast startup time.
trans-unit.target: Guidelines for building apps that are fast, responsive, considerate of battery life with a fast startup time.

trans-unit.source: Android provides the **Best Practices for Performance** training guide.
trans-unit.target: Android provides the **Best Practices for Performance** training guide.

trans-unit.source: iOS provides the **Performance Overview** document.
trans-unit.target: iOS provides the **Performance Overview** document.

trans-unit.source: You can read the detailed **[Performance guide](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt270266.aspx)** with sections covering topics such as; setting performance goals, measuring performance, memory management, smooth animations, efficient file system access and the tools available for profiling and performance.
trans-unit.target: You can read the detailed **[Performance guide](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt270266.aspx)** with sections covering topics such as; setting performance goals, measuring performance, memory management, smooth animations, efficient file system access and the tools available for profiling and performance.

trans-unit.source: View optimization for a responsive UI.
trans-unit.target: View optimization for a responsive UI.

trans-unit.source: Improving performance by optimizing views.
trans-unit.target: Improving performance by optimizing views.

trans-unit.source: Optimizing **layout hierarchies** using the Hierarchy Viewer tool, **reusing layouts** and loading **views on demand** are all techniques to help keep the UI thread responsive and avoid "Application Not Responding" dialogs (**ANR's**).
trans-unit.target: Optimizing **layout hierarchies** using the Hierarchy Viewer tool, **reusing layouts** and loading **views on demand** are all techniques to help keep the UI thread responsive and avoid "Application Not Responding" dialogs (**ANR's**).

trans-unit.source: Fixing UI issues with **offscreen rendering**, **blended layers**, **rasterization** using the **Core Animation** tool help keep the UI thread responsive.
trans-unit.target: Fixing UI issues with **offscreen rendering**, **blended layers**, **rasterization** using the **Core Animation** tool help keep the UI thread responsive.

trans-unit.source: You can easily **optimize** XAML **markup** and **layouts** by following a few simple steps.
trans-unit.target: You can easily **optimize** XAML **markup** and **layouts** by following a few simple steps.

trans-unit.source: Techniques include reducing layout structure, minimizing the element count and minimizing overdrawing.
trans-unit.target: Techniques include reducing layout structure, minimizing the element count and minimizing overdrawing.

trans-unit.source: Keep the UI thread responsive
trans-unit.target: Keep the UI thread responsive

trans-unit.source: Optimize your XAML markup
trans-unit.target: Optimize your XAML markup

trans-unit.source: Optimize your XAML layout
trans-unit.target: Optimize your XAML layout

trans-unit.source: Threading.
trans-unit.target: Threading.

trans-unit.source: Use of threading to maintain a **responsive UI** and run multiple **tasks in parallel**.
trans-unit.target: Use of threading to maintain a **responsive UI** and run multiple **tasks in parallel**.

trans-unit.source: Threading is achieved using the classes **Runnable**, **Handler**, **ThreadPoolExecutor**, and the higher level **AsyncTask**.
trans-unit.target: Threading is achieved using the classes **Runnable**, **Handler**, **ThreadPoolExecutor**, and the higher level **AsyncTask**.

trans-unit.source: Threading is achieved using **NSThread**, **Grand Central Dispatch**, and the higher level **NSOperation**.
trans-unit.target: Threading is achieved using **NSThread**, **Grand Central Dispatch**, and the higher level **NSOperation**.

trans-unit.source: You can work with threads by submitting **work items** to the **threadpool** with **[RunAsync](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.system.threading.threadpool.runasync.aspx)**.
trans-unit.target: You can work with threads by submitting **work items** to the **threadpool** with **[RunAsync](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.system.threading.threadpool.runasync.aspx)**.

trans-unit.source: You can use a timer to submit a work item with **[CreateTimer](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br230590.aspx)** and create a repeating work item with **[CreatePeriodicTimer](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br230589.aspx)**.
trans-unit.target: You can use a timer to submit a work item with **[CreateTimer](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br230590.aspx)** and create a repeating work item with **[CreatePeriodicTimer](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br230589.aspx)**.

trans-unit.source: Submit a work item to the thread pool
trans-unit.target: Submit a work item to the thread pool

trans-unit.source: Use a timer to submit a work item
trans-unit.target: Use a timer to submit a work item

trans-unit.source: Asynchronous programming.
trans-unit.target: Asynchronous programming.

trans-unit.source: Avoid threading complexity by taking advantage of asynchronous programming patterns to keep the UI thread responsive.
trans-unit.target: Avoid threading complexity by taking advantage of asynchronous programming patterns to keep the UI thread responsive.

trans-unit.source: The use of **threading is required** to create your own asynchronous classes.
trans-unit.target: The use of **threading is required** to create your own asynchronous classes.

trans-unit.source: Some built-in classes are asynchronous.
trans-unit.target: Some built-in classes are asynchronous.

trans-unit.source: The use of **threading is required** is required to create your own asynchronous classes.
trans-unit.target: The use of **threading is required** is required to create your own asynchronous classes.

trans-unit.source: Some built-in classes are asynchronous.
trans-unit.target: Some built-in classes are asynchronous.

trans-unit.source: You can use asynchronous patterns to avoid blocking the main thread when you create your own APIs, e.g. using **async** and **await** in C# and Visual Basic.
trans-unit.target: You can use asynchronous patterns to avoid blocking the main thread when you create your own APIs, e.g. using **async** and **await** in C# and Visual Basic.

trans-unit.source: You can use the asynchronous built-in APIs which end in the word **Async**.
trans-unit.target: You can use the asynchronous built-in APIs which end in the word **Async**.

trans-unit.source: List view optimization.
trans-unit.target: List view optimization.

trans-unit.source: Built-in patterns to aid with optimizing lists of data, which often have poor performance when large amounts of data need to be shown
trans-unit.target: Built-in patterns to aid with optimizing lists of data, which often have poor performance when large amounts of data need to be shown

trans-unit.source: The **ViewHolder** design pattern is used to avoid multiple view lookups, which allows you to use reusable UI elements.
trans-unit.target: The **ViewHolder** design pattern is used to avoid multiple view lookups, which allows you to use reusable UI elements.

trans-unit.source: A range of optimizations can be made to improve the performance of **UITableView**, nothing is built-in.
trans-unit.target: A range of optimizations can be made to improve the performance of **UITableView**, nothing is built-in.

trans-unit.source: You can use the [ListView](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.listview.aspx) and [GridView](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.gridview.aspx) controls which provide **UI virtualization** out-of-box, providing a smooth panning and scrolling experience and a faster startup time.
trans-unit.target: You can use the [ListView](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.listview.aspx) and [GridView](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.gridview.aspx) controls which provide **UI virtualization** out-of-box, providing a smooth panning and scrolling experience and a faster startup time.

trans-unit.source: You can also implement [IList](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/system.collections.ilist.aspx) and [INotifyCollectionChanged](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/system.collections.specialized.inotifycollectionchanged.aspx) in your data source, providing **data virtualization** and further improving performance.
trans-unit.target: You can also implement [IList](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/system.collections.ilist.aspx) and [INotifyCollectionChanged](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/system.collections.specialized.inotifycollectionchanged.aspx) in your data source, providing **data virtualization** and further improving performance.

trans-unit.source: In-app purchases.
trans-unit.target: In-app purchases.

trans-unit.source: Platform features that allow users to make purchases in your apps.
trans-unit.target: Platform features that allow users to make purchases in your apps.

trans-unit.source: **In-app billing** is provided by Google Services.
trans-unit.target: **In-app billing** is provided by Google Services.

trans-unit.source: Products are added to the **Google Play Developer Console**.
trans-unit.target: Products are added to the **Google Play Developer Console**.

trans-unit.source: In-app purchases are implemented with the **Google Play Billing Library**.
trans-unit.target: In-app purchases are implemented with the **Google Play Billing Library**.

trans-unit.source: Products are added to **iTunes Connect**.
trans-unit.target: Products are added to **iTunes Connect**.

trans-unit.source: In-app purchases are implemented using the **StoreKit** framework.
trans-unit.target: In-app purchases are implemented using the **StoreKit** framework.

trans-unit.source: Products are purchased using **SKMutablePayment** and **SKPaymentQueue**.
trans-unit.target: Products are purchased using **SKMutablePayment** and **SKPaymentQueue**.

trans-unit.source: You create in-app product purchases for your app by [adding them to your app and submitting them to the Store](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt148551.aspx).
trans-unit.target: You create in-app product purchases for your app by [adding them to your app and submitting them to the Store](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt148551.aspx).

trans-unit.source: You use the **[CurrentApp class](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.applicationmodel.store.currentapp.aspx)** to define in-app purchases.
trans-unit.target: You use the **[CurrentApp class](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.applicationmodel.store.currentapp.aspx)** to define in-app purchases.

trans-unit.source: You use **[CurrentApp.RequestProductPurchaseAsync](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.applicationmodel.store.currentapp.requestproductpurchaseasync.aspx)** to display the UI that allows customers to purchase the product.
trans-unit.target: You use **[CurrentApp.RequestProductPurchaseAsync](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.applicationmodel.store.currentapp.requestproductpurchaseasync.aspx)** to display the UI that allows customers to purchase the product.

trans-unit.source: Enable in-app product purchases
trans-unit.target: Enable in-app product purchases

trans-unit.source: Consumable in-app purchases.
trans-unit.target: Consumable in-app purchases.

trans-unit.source: In-app products which can be purchased, used and then purchased again.
trans-unit.target: In-app products which can be purchased, used and then purchased again.

trans-unit.source: Consumable purchases are enabled by making a regular purchase and then consuming it with **consumePurchase**, enabling it to be purchased, used, and then purchased again.
trans-unit.target: Consumable purchases are enabled by making a regular purchase and then consuming it with **consumePurchase**, enabling it to be purchased, used, and then purchased again.

trans-unit.source: Consumable products are **defined as consumable products** in iTunes Connect.
trans-unit.target: Consumable products are **defined as consumable products** in iTunes Connect.

trans-unit.source: You can support consumables by [defining their product type as Consumable when you submit them to](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt148534.aspx) the Store.
trans-unit.target: You can support consumables by [defining their product type as Consumable when you submit them to](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt148534.aspx) the Store.

trans-unit.source: You then call **[CurrentApp.ReportConsumableFulfillmentAsync](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.applicationmodel.store.currentapp.reportconsumablefulfillmentasync.aspx)** after a consumable purchase has been made to allow the customer to access it.
trans-unit.target: You then call **[CurrentApp.ReportConsumableFulfillmentAsync](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.applicationmodel.store.currentapp.reportconsumablefulfillmentasync.aspx)** after a consumable purchase has been made to allow the customer to access it.

trans-unit.source: Enable consumable in-app purchases
trans-unit.target: Enable consumable in-app purchases

trans-unit.source: Testing in-app purchases.
trans-unit.target: Testing in-app purchases.

trans-unit.source: Enabling you to test your in-app purchase code without putting your app in the Store.
trans-unit.target: Enabling you to test your in-app purchase code without putting your app in the Store.

trans-unit.source: The **in-app billing sandbox** is used for testing.
trans-unit.target: The **in-app billing sandbox** is used for testing.

trans-unit.source: **Sandbox tester accounts** are used for testing.
trans-unit.target: **Sandbox tester accounts** are used for testing.

trans-unit.source: You can test in-app purchases by simply using the **[CurrentAppSimulator](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.applicationmodel.store.currentappsimulator.aspx)** class in place of CurrentApp.
trans-unit.target: You can test in-app purchases by simply using the **[CurrentAppSimulator](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.applicationmodel.store.currentappsimulator.aspx)** class in place of CurrentApp.

trans-unit.source: Trials.
trans-unit.target: Trials.

trans-unit.source: Enabling you to easily limit content or remove advertising based on a trial version of an app.
trans-unit.target: Enabling you to easily limit content or remove advertising based on a trial version of an app.

trans-unit.source: Google Play **doesn't officially support app trials**.
trans-unit.target: Google Play **doesn't officially support app trials**.

trans-unit.source: Trials or removing advertising is achieved by creating an in-app purchase and taking the appropriate code path when confirming the purchase was successful.
trans-unit.target: Trials or removing advertising is achieved by creating an in-app purchase and taking the appropriate code path when confirming the purchase was successful.

trans-unit.source: The App Store **doesn't officially support app trials**.
trans-unit.target: The App Store **doesn't officially support app trials**.

trans-unit.source: Trials or removing advertising is achieved by creating an in-app purchase and taking the appropriate code path when confirming the purchase was successful.
trans-unit.target: Trials or removing advertising is achieved by creating an in-app purchase and taking the appropriate code path when confirming the purchase was successful.

trans-unit.source: You can offer a free trial version of your app by using the **['Free Trial' option](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt148548.aspx)** when submitting your app to the Store.
trans-unit.target: You can offer a free trial version of your app by using the **['Free Trial' option](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt148548.aspx)** when submitting your app to the Store.

trans-unit.source: You can then use **[LicenseInformation.IsTrial](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.applicationmodel.store.licenseinformation.istrial.aspx)** to check the trial status of the app and present different code paths accordingly.
trans-unit.target: You can then use **[LicenseInformation.IsTrial](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.applicationmodel.store.licenseinformation.istrial.aspx)** to check the trial status of the app and present different code paths accordingly.

trans-unit.source: You can register for the [LicenseChanged event](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.applicationmodel.store.licenseinformation.licensechanged) to be notified when the user changes the trial status while the app is running.
trans-unit.target: You can register for the [LicenseChanged event](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.applicationmodel.store.licenseinformation.licensechanged) to be notified when the user changes the trial status while the app is running.

trans-unit.source: Adaptive UI: flexible layouts.
trans-unit.target: Adaptive UI: flexible layouts.

trans-unit.source: Supporting different screen sizes with a flexible height and width.
trans-unit.target: Supporting different screen sizes with a flexible height and width.

trans-unit.source: Flexible layouts can be achieved using the **wrap_content** and **match_parent** values in LinearLayout objects, or by making use of RelativeLayout objects for alignment.
trans-unit.target: Flexible layouts can be achieved using the **wrap_content** and **match_parent** values in LinearLayout objects, or by making use of RelativeLayout objects for alignment.

trans-unit.source: Flexible layouts can be achieved using the **adaptive model** with universal Storyboards, making use of **Auto Layout** with **constraints** and **traits** such as horizontalSizeClass and displayScale which are applied to view controllers.
trans-unit.target: Flexible layouts can be achieved using the **adaptive model** with universal Storyboards, making use of **Auto Layout** with **constraints** and **traits** such as horizontalSizeClass and displayScale which are applied to view controllers.

trans-unit.source: You can create a fluid layout using **layout properties** and **panels** with a combination of fixed and dynamic sizing.
trans-unit.target: You can create a fluid layout using **layout properties** and **panels** with a combination of fixed and dynamic sizing.

trans-unit.target: Define layouts with XAML - layout properties and panels

trans-unit.target: Responsive design 101

trans-unit.source: Adaptive UI: tailored layouts.
trans-unit.target: Adaptive UI: tailored layouts.

trans-unit.source: Supporting different screen sizes with separate targeted layouts.
trans-unit.target: Supporting different screen sizes with separate targeted layouts.

trans-unit.source: Providing alternative layout files for different screen configurations in the resources directory using **configuration qualifiers** such as **small**, **large**, **ldpi**, and **hdpi** allows you to target custom layouts to screens of varying size and density.
trans-unit.target: Providing alternative layout files for different screen configurations in the resources directory using **configuration qualifiers** such as **small**, **large**, **ldpi**, and **hdpi** allows you to target custom layouts to screens of varying size and density.

trans-unit.source: Define a **separate iPhone and iPad Storyboard** to tailor layouts to different device families in a universal app.
trans-unit.target: Define a **separate iPhone and iPad Storyboard** to tailor layouts to different device families in a universal app.

trans-unit.source: You can build a tailored layout by defining **different XAML markup files** per device family.
trans-unit.target: You can build a tailored layout by defining **different XAML markup files** per device family.

trans-unit.source: Define layouts with XAML - tailored layouts
trans-unit.target: Define layouts with XAML - tailored layouts

trans-unit.source: Adaptive UI: responsive layouts.
trans-unit.target: Adaptive UI: responsive layouts.

trans-unit.source: Responding to changes in screen size, such as rotation, or a change in the size of a window.
trans-unit.target: Responding to changes in screen size, such as rotation, or a change in the size of a window.

trans-unit.source: Use of flexible layouts with **LinearLayout** and **RelativeLayout**, or providing alternative layout files for different orientations enable responsive layouts.
trans-unit.target: Use of flexible layouts with **LinearLayout** and **RelativeLayout**, or providing alternative layout files for different orientations enable responsive layouts.

trans-unit.source: When the **size** or **traits** of a view change, the **constraints** specified in storyboards are applied.
trans-unit.target: When the **size** or **traits** of a view change, the **constraints** specified in storyboards are applied.

trans-unit.source: You can easily reflow, reposition, resize, reveal, or replace sections of your UI at runtime in response to window size changes using **[VisualState](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.visualstate.aspx)**, the **[VisualStateManager](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.visualstatemanager.aspx)** and **[AdaptiveTrigger](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.adaptivetrigger.aspx)**.
trans-unit.target: You can easily reflow, reposition, resize, reveal, or replace sections of your UI at runtime in response to window size changes using **[VisualState](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.visualstate.aspx)**, the **[VisualStateManager](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.visualstatemanager.aspx)** and **[AdaptiveTrigger](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.adaptivetrigger.aspx)**.

trans-unit.target: Define layouts with XAML - visual states and state triggers

trans-unit.source: Supporting different device capabilities.
trans-unit.target: Supporting different device capabilities.

trans-unit.source: Take advantage of advanced hardware features while still supporting devices without them.
trans-unit.target: Take advantage of advanced hardware features while still supporting devices without them.

trans-unit.source: Testing for device features at runtime using **PackageManager.hasSystemFeature** enables you to decide if hardware specific code can run.
trans-unit.target: Testing for device features at runtime using **PackageManager.hasSystemFeature** enables you to decide if hardware specific code can run.

trans-unit.source: There is **no single check** you can perform at runtime to test for device features, you test for each feature in a specific way to decide if hardware specific code can be run.
trans-unit.target: There is **no single check** you can perform at runtime to test for device features, you test for each feature in a specific way to decide if hardware specific code can be run.

trans-unit.source: You can add **platform extension SDKs** to your package to target additional functionality found in different device families including phone, desktop, and IoT.
trans-unit.target: You can add **platform extension SDKs** to your package to target additional functionality found in different device families including phone, desktop, and IoT.

trans-unit.source: You use the **[ApiInformation API](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.foundation.metadata.apiinformation.aspx)** to test for the presence of types and members at runtime, and can call those types and members only if they're present.
trans-unit.target: You use the **[ApiInformation API](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.foundation.metadata.apiinformation.aspx)** to test for the presence of types and members at runtime, and can call those types and members only if they're present.

trans-unit.source: Supporting different device capabilities.
trans-unit.target: Supporting different device capabilities.

trans-unit.source: Take advantage of advanced hardware features while still supporting devices without them.
trans-unit.target: Take advantage of advanced hardware features while still supporting devices without them.

trans-unit.source: The **Android Support Library** can be packaged with your app to make some newer APIs available to those with older versions of Android.
trans-unit.target: The **Android Support Library** can be packaged with your app to make some newer APIs available to those with older versions of Android.

trans-unit.source: Testing for the API level at runtime can be done using **Build.Version.SDK_INT**.
trans-unit.target: Testing for the API level at runtime can be done using **Build.Version.SDK_INT**.

trans-unit.source: Standard runtime checks are used to find out if APIs are available, such as the **class** method to check if a class exists and **respondsToSelector:** to check for methods on classes.
trans-unit.target: Standard runtime checks are used to find out if APIs are available, such as the **class** method to check if a class exists and **respondsToSelector:** to check for methods on classes.

trans-unit.source: You can use **[ApiInformation.IsApiContractPresent](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn949005.aspx)** to identify if an API contract with a specified major and minor number is present.
trans-unit.target: You can use **[ApiInformation.IsApiContractPresent](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn949005.aspx)** to identify if an API contract with a specified major and minor number is present.

trans-unit.source: You also use the **[ApiInformation API](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.foundation.metadata.apiinformation.aspx)** to test for the presence of types and members at runtime, and can call those types and members only if they're present.
trans-unit.target: You also use the **[ApiInformation API](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.foundation.metadata.apiinformation.aspx)** to test for the presence of types and members at runtime, and can call those types and members only if they're present.

trans-unit.source: Present updates to users on the home screen.

trans-unit.source: **App Widgets** are views on your application that can be embedded into the home screen and can receive periodic updates.
trans-unit.target: **App Widgets** are views on your application that can be embedded into the home screen and can receive periodic updates.

trans-unit.source: **No badge system** exists on Android.
trans-unit.target: **No badge system** exists on Android.

trans-unit.source: **No tiles or widgets** exist on iOS.
