trans-unit.target: You can add a **badge** to your icon with a number which can change in response to local or remote notifications.

trans-unit.source: Your app has a **tile** which can be pinned to the start screen and is used to display your choice of text, images, and a **badge** with glyphs and numbers.
trans-unit.target: Your app has a **tile** which can be pinned to the start screen and is used to display your choice of text, images, and a **badge** with glyphs and numbers.

trans-unit.source: You can update the content of tiles from the app; via push notifications or at predefined schedules.
trans-unit.target: You can update the content of tiles from the app; via push notifications or at predefined schedules.

trans-unit.source: Tiles can be adaptive, and can change according to where they are being displayed.
trans-unit.target: Tiles can be adaptive, and can change according to where they are being displayed.

trans-unit.source: Using an **intent** such as MediaStore.ACTION_VIDEO_CAPTURE allows media to be captured with an existing camera app.

trans-unit.source: The **AVFoundation** classes such as **AVCaptureSession** enable direct access to the camera.
trans-unit.target: The **AVFoundation** classes such as **AVCaptureSession** enable direct access to the camera.

trans-unit.source: The **AVAudioRecorder** class enables audio recording.
trans-unit.target: The **AVAudioRecorder** class enables audio recording.

trans-unit.source: You can capture photos and video while using the built-in camera UI with the **[CameraCaptureUI class](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.media.capture.cameracaptureui.aspx)**.
trans-unit.target: You can capture photos and video while using the built-in camera UI with the **[CameraCaptureUI class](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.media.capture.cameracaptureui.aspx)**.

trans-unit.source: You can interact with the camera at a low level, and capture audio with classes in **[Windows.Media.Capture](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.media.capture.aspx)** such as the **[MediaCapture API](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.media.capture.mediacapture.aspx)**.

trans-unit.target: The **MediaPlayer** and **AudioManager** classes are used to play audio and video files.

trans-unit.source: The **AVKit framework**, **AVAudioPlayer**, and **Media Player Framework** are used to play audio and video files.

trans-unit.source: You can use the **[MediaSource class](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.media.core.mediasource.aspx)**, **[MediaElement](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.mediaelement.aspx)**, and **[MediaPlayer](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.media.playback.mediaplayer.aspx)** classes to play back audio and video from sources such as local and remote files.
trans-unit.target: You can use the **[MediaSource class](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.media.core.mediasource.aspx)**, **[MediaElement](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.mediaelement.aspx)**, and **[MediaPlayer](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.media.playback.mediaplayer.aspx)** classes to play back audio and video from sources such as local and remote files.

trans-unit.target: Composing new media files from existing recordings and applying special effects.

trans-unit.target: Low level classes such as **MediaCodec**, **MediaMuxer**, and **android.media.effect** can be used for content editing.

trans-unit.source: Classes in the **AV Foundation** framework such as **AVMutableComposition**, **AVMutableVideoComposition**, and **AVMutableAudioMix** can be used for content editing.
trans-unit.target: Classes in the **AV Foundation** framework such as **AVMutableComposition**, **AVMutableVideoComposition**, and **AVMutableAudioMix** can be used for content editing.

trans-unit.source: You can use the **[Windows.Media.Editing](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.media.editing.aspx)** APIs such as **[MediaComposition](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.media.editing.mediacomposition.aspx)** and **[MediaClip](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.media.editing.mediaclip.aspx)** to create media compositions from audio and video files.
trans-unit.target: You can use the **[Windows.Media.Editing](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.media.editing.aspx)** APIs such as **[MediaComposition](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.media.editing.mediacomposition.aspx)** and **[MediaClip](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.media.editing.mediaclip.aspx)** to create media compositions from audio and video files.

trans-unit.source: The **Core Motion framework** is used to access raw and processed sensor data.
trans-unit.target: The **Core Motion framework** is used to access raw and processed sensor data.

trans-unit.source: You can use classes in **[Windows.Devices.Sensors](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.sensors.aspx)** to access sensor readings and events triggered when new reading data is received from the sensor.

trans-unit.source: Location.
trans-unit.target: Location.

trans-unit.source: Finding the device's **current** location and tracking **changes**.
trans-unit.target: Finding the device's **current** location and tracking **changes**.

trans-unit.source: The Google Play services location APIs provide high-level access to the **last known location** with the **fused location provider** using the **getLastLocation** and **requestLocationUpdates** methods.
trans-unit.target: The Google Play services location APIs provide high-level access to the **last known location** with the **fused location provider** using the **getLastLocation** and **requestLocationUpdates** methods.

trans-unit.source: Low-level access is provided in the Android libraries with the **LocationManager**.
trans-unit.target: Low-level access is provided in the Android libraries with the **LocationManager**.

trans-unit.source: The **Core Location** **CLLocationManager** class is used to monitor a device's location, with **startUpdatingLocation** for the standard location service and **startMonitoringSignificantLocationChanges** for the **significant-change** location service.
trans-unit.target: The **Core Location** **CLLocationManager** class is used to monitor a device's location, with **startUpdatingLocation** for the standard location service and **startMonitoringSignificantLocationChanges** for the **significant-change** location service.

trans-unit.source: You can track device location with classes in **[Windows.Devices.Geolocation](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.geolocation.aspx)**.
trans-unit.target: You can track device location with classes in **[Windows.Devices.Geolocation](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.geolocation.aspx)**.

trans-unit.source: Use **[Geolocator.GetGeopositionAsync](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225537.aspx)** for a one-time reading.
trans-unit.target: Use **[Geolocator.GetGeopositionAsync](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225537.aspx)** for a one-time reading.

trans-unit.source: Use **[Geolocator.PositionChanged](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.geolocation.geolocator.positionchanged.aspx)** to obtain the location regularly using a timer, or be informed when the location has changed.
trans-unit.target: Use **[Geolocator.PositionChanged](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.geolocation.geolocator.positionchanged.aspx)** to obtain the location regularly using a timer, or be informed when the location has changed.

trans-unit.source: Get the user's location
trans-unit.target: Get the user's location

trans-unit.source: Displaying maps.
trans-unit.target: Displaying maps.

trans-unit.source: Displaying an **interactive built-in map** and adding **points of interest**.
trans-unit.target: Displaying an **interactive built-in map** and adding **points of interest**.

trans-unit.source: The **GoogleMap**, **MapFragment**, and **MapView** classes within the **Google Maps Android API** allow maps to be embedded in apps.
trans-unit.target: The **GoogleMap**, **MapFragment**, and **MapView** classes within the **Google Maps Android API** allow maps to be embedded in apps.

trans-unit.source: Points of interest can be displayed using **markers** and the customizable **Marker** class.
trans-unit.target: Points of interest can be displayed using **markers** and the customizable **Marker** class.

trans-unit.source: Maps are embedded into iOS apps with the **MKMapView** class in the **MapKit framework**.
trans-unit.target: Maps are embedded into iOS apps with the **MKMapView** class in the **MapKit framework**.

trans-unit.source: **Annotations** can be added to apps to display points of interest using object classes such as **MKPointAnnotation** and view classes such as **MKPinAnnotationView**.
trans-unit.target: **Annotations** can be added to apps to display points of interest using object classes such as **MKPointAnnotation** and view classes such as **MKPinAnnotationView**.

trans-unit.source: You can embed maps in your apps using the built-in **[MapControl](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.maps.mapcontrol.aspx)** XAML control which provides 2D, 3D, and streetside views.
trans-unit.target: You can embed maps in your apps using the built-in **[MapControl](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.maps.mapcontrol.aspx)** XAML control which provides 2D, 3D, and streetside views.

trans-unit.source: You can add points of interest with a pushpin, image, or shape using classes such as **[MapIcon](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.maps.mapicon.aspx)**, **[MapPolygon](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.maps.mappolygon.aspx)** and **[MapPolyline](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.maps.mappolyline.aspx)**.
trans-unit.target: You can add points of interest with a pushpin, image, or shape using classes such as **[MapIcon](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.maps.mapicon.aspx)**, **[MapPolygon](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.maps.mappolygon.aspx)** and **[MapPolyline](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.maps.mappolyline.aspx)**.

trans-unit.target: Display maps with 2D, 3D, and Streetside views

trans-unit.source: Geofencing.
trans-unit.target: Geofencing.

trans-unit.source: Monitor the entering and leaving of a particular geographic region.
trans-unit.target: Monitor the entering and leaving of a particular geographic region.

trans-unit.source: Geofences are monitored using the **Location Services** in the Google Play Services SDK.
trans-unit.target: Geofences are monitored using the **Location Services** in the Google Play Services SDK.

trans-unit.source: Regions are monitored with the **CLCircularRegion** class and registered with the **CLLocationManager.startMonitoringForRegion:**.
trans-unit.target: Regions are monitored with the **CLCircularRegion** class and registered with the **CLLocationManager.startMonitoringForRegion:**.

trans-unit.source: You can create a geofence with the **[Geofence](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.geolocation.geofencing.geofence.aspx)** class and define your **monitored states** such as entering or leaving a region.
trans-unit.target: You can create a geofence with the **[Geofence](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.geolocation.geofencing.geofence.aspx)** class and define your **monitored states** such as entering or leaving a region.

trans-unit.source: Handle geofence events in the foreground with the **[GeofenceMonitor class](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.geolocation.geofencing.geofencemonitor.aspx)**, and in the background with the **[LocationTrigger background class](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.applicationmodel.background.locationtrigger.aspx)**.
trans-unit.target: Handle geofence events in the foreground with the **[GeofenceMonitor class](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.devices.geolocation.geofencing.geofencemonitor.aspx)**, and in the background with the **[LocationTrigger background class](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.applicationmodel.background.locationtrigger.aspx)**.

trans-unit.target: Set up a geofence

trans-unit.source: Geocoding and reverse geocoding.
trans-unit.target: Geocoding and reverse geocoding.

trans-unit.source: Converting addresses to geographic locations (geocoding) and converting geographic locations to addresses (reverse geocoding).
trans-unit.target: Converting addresses to geographic locations (geocoding) and converting geographic locations to addresses (reverse geocoding).

trans-unit.source: The **Geocoder** class is used for geocoding and reverse geocoding.
trans-unit.target: The **Geocoder** class is used for geocoding and reverse geocoding.

trans-unit.source: The **CLGeocoder** class is used for geocoding.
trans-unit.target: The **CLGeocoder** class is used for geocoding.

trans-unit.source: You can perform geocoding using the **[MapLocationFinder class](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.services.maps.maplocationfinder.aspx)** in **[Windows.Services.Maps](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.services.maps.aspx)**.
trans-unit.target: You can perform geocoding using the **[MapLocationFinder class](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.services.maps.maplocationfinder.aspx)** in **[Windows.Services.Maps](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.services.maps.aspx)**.

trans-unit.source: You use **[FindLocationsAsync](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.services.maps.maplocationfinder.findlocationsasync.aspx)** for geocoding and **[FindLocationsAtAsync](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.services.maps.maplocationfinder.findlocationsatasync.aspx)** for reverse geocoding.
trans-unit.target: You use **[FindLocationsAsync](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.services.maps.maplocationfinder.findlocationsasync.aspx)** for geocoding and **[FindLocationsAtAsync](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.services.maps.maplocationfinder.findlocationsatasync.aspx)** for reverse geocoding.

trans-unit.source: Perform geocoding and reverse geocoding
trans-unit.target: Perform geocoding and reverse geocoding

trans-unit.source: Routes and directions.
trans-unit.target: Routes and directions.

trans-unit.source: Providing routes, distances, and directions between two geographical locations.
trans-unit.target: Providing routes, distances, and directions between two geographical locations.

trans-unit.source: Google provides the web service **Google Maps Directions API** which can be used on Android although no SDK is provided.
trans-unit.target: Google provides the web service **Google Maps Directions API** which can be used on Android although no SDK is provided.

trans-unit.source: Map Kit provides the **MKDirections** API which can be used to fetch information about a route and directions.
trans-unit.target: Map Kit provides the **MKDirections** API which can be used to fetch information about a route and directions.

trans-unit.source: You can request a walking or driving route with the **[MapRouteFinder](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.services.maps.maproutefinder.aspx)** class in **[Windows.Services.Maps](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.services.maps.aspx)**.
trans-unit.target: You can request a walking or driving route with the **[MapRouteFinder](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.services.maps.maproutefinder.aspx)** class in **[Windows.Services.Maps](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.services.maps.aspx)**.

trans-unit.source: Routes are returned as a **[MapRoute](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.services.maps.maproute.aspx)** instance which can be easily shown on a MapControl.
trans-unit.target: Routes are returned as a **[MapRoute](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.services.maps.maproute.aspx)** instance which can be easily shown on a MapControl.

trans-unit.source: Directions are returned inside the **[MapRouteManeuver](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.services.maps.maproutemaneuver.aspx)** object.
trans-unit.target: Directions are returned inside the **[MapRouteManeuver](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.services.maps.maproutemaneuver.aspx)** object.

trans-unit.target: Display routes and directions on a map

trans-unit.source: Invoking another app.
trans-unit.target: Invoking another app.

trans-unit.source: Launching another app, and optionally sharing data such as links, text, photos, videos, and files.
trans-unit.target: Launching another app, and optionally sharing data such as links, text, photos, videos, and files.

trans-unit.source: An **implicit intent** is used to launch another app, by defining an **action** and optional data in an **Intent** and calling it with **startActivityForResult**.
trans-unit.target: An **implicit intent** is used to launch another app, by defining an **action** and optional data in an **Intent** and calling it with **startActivityForResult**.

trans-unit.source: **App extensions** can be used to provide access to app data to another app.
trans-unit.target: **App extensions** can be used to provide access to app data to another app.

trans-unit.source: **URL schemes** enable a URL to be passed to another app.
trans-unit.target: **URL schemes** enable a URL to be passed to another app.

trans-unit.source: You can launch another app which has registered for a URI with **[Launcher.LaunchUriAsync](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.system.launcher.launchuriasync.aspx)**, or **[Launcher.LaunchUriForResultsAsync](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.system.launcher.launchuriforresultsasync.aspx)** to launch for results and get data back from the launched app.
trans-unit.target: You can launch another app which has registered for a URI with **[Launcher.LaunchUriAsync](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.system.launcher.launchuriasync.aspx)**, or **[Launcher.LaunchUriForResultsAsync](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.system.launcher.launchuriforresultsasync.aspx)** to launch for results and get data back from the launched app.

trans-unit.source: You can use **[Launcher.LaunchFileAsync](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701471.aspx)** to pass a file to another app to handle.
trans-unit.target: You can use **[Launcher.LaunchFileAsync](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701471.aspx)** to pass a file to another app to handle.

trans-unit.source: You can use a **share contract** to easily share data between apps.
trans-unit.target: You can use a **share contract** to easily share data between apps.

trans-unit.source: Launch the default app for a URI
trans-unit.target: Launch the default app for a URI

trans-unit.source: Launch an app for results
trans-unit.target: Launch an app for results

trans-unit.source: Launch the default app for a file
trans-unit.target: Launch the default app for a file

trans-unit.target: Share data

trans-unit.source: Allowing your app to be invoked.
trans-unit.target: Allowing your app to be invoked.

trans-unit.source: Allow your app to respond to a request from another app.
trans-unit.target: Allow your app to respond to a request from another app.

trans-unit.source: Apps register an **intent handling activity** with an **intent filter** to respond to an implicit intent from another app.
trans-unit.target: Apps register an **intent handling activity** with an **intent filter** to respond to an implicit intent from another app.

trans-unit.source: Packaging an **app extension** enables data to be shared with other apps.
trans-unit.target: Packaging an **app extension** enables data to be shared with other apps.

trans-unit.source: Apps can register a **custom URL scheme** using the **CFBundleURLTypes** key in Info.plist.
trans-unit.target: Apps can register a **custom URL scheme** using the **CFBundleURLTypes** key in Info.plist.

trans-unit.source: You can register your app to be the default handler for a **URI scheme name** by registering a **[protocol](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.applicationmodel.activation.activationkind.aspx#Protocol)** in the package manifest and updating the **[Application.OnActivated](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.application.onactivated.aspx)** event handler, optionally returning results.
trans-unit.target: You can register your app to be the default handler for a **URI scheme name** by registering a **[protocol](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.applicationmodel.activation.activationkind.aspx#Protocol)** in the package manifest and updating the **[Application.OnActivated](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.application.onactivated.aspx)** event handler, optionally returning results.

trans-unit.source: In the same way you can register your app to be the default handler for certain file types by adding a declaration in the package manifest and handling the **[Application.OnFileActivated](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.application.onfileactivated.aspx)** event.
trans-unit.target: In the same way you can register your app to be the default handler for certain file types by adding a declaration in the package manifest and handling the **[Application.OnFileActivated](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.application.onfileactivated.aspx)** event.

trans-unit.source: You can handle share contract requests by registering your app as a share target in the manifest and handling the **[Application.OnShareTargetActivated](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.application.onsharetargetactivated.aspx)** event.
trans-unit.target: You can handle share contract requests by registering your app as a share target in the manifest and handling the **[Application.OnShareTargetActivated](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.application.onsharetargetactivated.aspx)** event.

trans-unit.source: Copy and paste.
trans-unit.target: Copy and paste.

trans-unit.source: Copy and pasting text and other content between apps.
trans-unit.target: Copy and pasting text and other content between apps.

trans-unit.source: The **clipboard framework** can be used to implement copy and paste with the **ClipboardManager** and **ClipData** classes.
trans-unit.target: The **clipboard framework** can be used to implement copy and paste with the **ClipboardManager** and **ClipData** classes.

trans-unit.source: The **UIPasteboard**, **UIMenuController**, and **UIResponderStandardEditActions** can be used to implement copy and paste.
trans-unit.target: The **UIPasteboard**, **UIMenuController**, and **UIResponderStandardEditActions** can be used to implement copy and paste.

trans-unit.source: Many default XAML controls already support copy and paste.
trans-unit.target: Many default XAML controls already support copy and paste.

trans-unit.source: You can implement copy and paste yourself using the **[DataPackage](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.applicationmodel.datatransfer.datapackage.aspx)** and **[Clipboard](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.applicationmodel.datatransfer.clipboard.aspx)** classes in **[Windows.ApplicationModel.DataTransfer](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br205967)**.
trans-unit.target: You can implement copy and paste yourself using the **[DataPackage](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.applicationmodel.datatransfer.datapackage.aspx)** and **[Clipboard](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.applicationmodel.datatransfer.clipboard.aspx)** classes in **[Windows.ApplicationModel.DataTransfer](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br205967)**.

trans-unit.source: Drag and drop.
trans-unit.target: Drag and drop.

trans-unit.source: Dragging and dropping content between apps.
trans-unit.target: Dragging and dropping content between apps.

trans-unit.source: Drag and drop can be implemented within a single application by using the **Android drag/drop framework**.
trans-unit.target: Drag and drop can be implemented within a single application by using the **Android drag/drop framework**.

trans-unit.source: No high-level drag and drop APIs are provided by iOS.
trans-unit.target: No high-level drag and drop APIs are provided by iOS.

trans-unit.source: You can implement dragging and dropping in your app to enable app-to-app, desktop-to-app, and app-to-desktop drag and drop capabilities.
trans-unit.target: You can implement dragging and dropping in your app to enable app-to-app, desktop-to-app, and app-to-desktop drag and drop capabilities.

trans-unit.source: You implement drag and drop support in the UIElement class with the **[AllowDrop](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.uielement.allowdrop.aspx)**, and **[CanDrag](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.uielement.candrag.aspx)** properties, and the **[DragOver](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.uielement.dragover.aspx)**, and **[Drop](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.uielement.drop.aspx)** events.
trans-unit.target: You implement drag and drop support in the UIElement class with the **[AllowDrop](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.uielement.allowdrop.aspx)**, and **[CanDrag](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.uielement.candrag.aspx)** properties, and the **[DragOver](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.uielement.dragover.aspx)**, and **[Drop](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.uielement.drop.aspx)** events.

trans-unit.source: Software design patterns.
trans-unit.target: Software design patterns.

trans-unit.source: Recommended or well-used patterns for the platform.
trans-unit.target: Recommended or well-used patterns for the platform.

trans-unit.source: No formal pattern has been recommended or provided for Android development, although the beta Data Binding Framework may enable more widespread use of the **Model-View-ViewModel (MVVM)** pattern.
trans-unit.target: No formal pattern has been recommended or provided for Android development, although the beta Data Binding Framework may enable more widespread use of the **Model-View-ViewModel (MVVM)** pattern.

trans-unit.source: A number of third party articles and frameworks recommend the **Model-View-Presenter (MVP)** and **MVVM** approaches.
trans-unit.target: A number of third party articles and frameworks recommend the **Model-View-Presenter (MVP)** and **MVVM** approaches.

trans-unit.source: **Model-View-Controller (MVC)** is a common pattern used with iOS and is integrated into the platform.
trans-unit.target: **Model-View-Controller (MVC)** is a common pattern used with iOS and is integrated into the platform.

trans-unit.source: You are not limited towards a specific pattern when building for UWP.
trans-unit.target: You are not limited towards a specific pattern when building for UWP.

trans-unit.source: You can use the built-in [data binding](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt210947.aspx) pattern to ensure clean separation of data concerns and UI concerns, and avoid having to code up UI event handlers which then update property values.
trans-unit.target: You can use the built-in [data binding](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt210947.aspx) pattern to ensure clean separation of data concerns and UI concerns, and avoid having to code up UI event handlers which then update property values.

trans-unit.source: You can extend data binding to follow the **Model-View-ViewModel (MVVM)** pattern, either by making use of third-party MVVM libraries such as [MVVM Light Toolkit](https://mvvmlight.codeplex.com/), or rolling your own and keeping logic out of code-behind.
trans-unit.target: You can extend data binding to follow the **Model-View-ViewModel (MVVM)** pattern, either by making use of third-party MVVM libraries such as [MVVM Light Toolkit](https://mvvmlight.codeplex.com/), or rolling your own and keeping logic out of code-behind.

trans-unit.target: The MVVM Pattern
